page.title: 12FARMING FISHING BRAE
page.content: TRADITIONAL Shetland has always been a fishing centre.In the past men were involved in the Herring fleet and the Whaling industry.Many young men go to the Fishing nowadays.They travel out of our area to join the trawlers in Burra,Whalsay and Lerwick. SALMON CAGES AND MUSSEL RAFTS There are now new forms of fishing in the islands.Some people in our block have got involved in farming Salmon and Mussels.For mussels you position a raft in the voe,from this raft cables hang down into the water.The mussels grow on the cables.Salmon cages are made of plastic.Most of them come from Norway.The salmon have to be fed 4 times a day with special food.The food turns the salmon red or pink.
